metadata.title: Square Meters to Square Feet (m² to ft²) Converter – Official Standard
metadata.description: Convert square meters to square feet using the exact international standard. Get precise area conversions for real estate, construction, and flooring projects.

introduction: This square meters to square feet converter provides engineering-grade precision for professionals and homeowners in real estate, construction, and interior design.

Every calculation is based on the international standard where 1 foot equals exactly 0.3048 meters, ensuring your area conversions are accurate and reliable for floor plans, material estimates, and land parcels.
Avoid common rounding errors and confidently translate metric area measurements into imperial units with our authoritative tool, complete with the official formula and practical examples.
methodology: To convert square meters (m²) to square feet (ft²), the calculator multiplies the area in square meters by approximately 10.763910417.
This conversion factor is derived from the definition of the international foot, which was established by the 1959 International Yard and Pound Agreement as exactly 0.3048 meters.
Therefore, one square foot is equal to 0.3048 meters × 0.3048 meters, or 0.09290304 square meters. The conversion from square meters to square feet is the reciprocal of this value (1 / 0.09290304).
This standard is recognized by metrology institutions worldwide, including the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) in the United States.
examples: Real Estate: A European apartment listed as 80 m² is equivalent to approximately 861.11 ft², giving a potential buyer in the U.S. a clear understanding of its size.
Flooring Project: To cover a 40 m² living room with new carpet, you would need to purchase at least 430.56 ft² of material.
Landscaping: A garden plot measuring 25 m² provides about 269.1 ft² of space for planting.

faqs.question: What is the exact formula to convert square meters to square feet?
faqs.answer: The exact formula is: Square Feet = Square Meters / 0.09290304. This is equivalent to multiplying by approximately 10.76391.

faqs.question: How many square feet are in one square meter?
faqs.answer: There are approximately 10.764 square feet in one square meter. The exact value is 1 divided by 0.09290304.

faqs.question: Is this conversion different from the U.S. survey foot?
faqs.answer: This conversion is based on the international foot (0.3048 m). The U.S. survey foot was a slightly different historical measure for land surveying that was officially deprecated by NIST in 2023. For all modern area calculations, the international foot standard should be used.

faqs.question: Can I use this for calculating volume?
faqs.answer: No, this calculator is for two-dimensional area (length × width). For three-dimensional space (volume), you would need to use a cubic meters to cubic feet converter.

citations.label: NIST Special Publication 811: Guide for the Use of the International System of Units (SI)
citations.summary: Defines the conversion factors for SI and non-SI units, specifying the foot-to-meter relationship as exactly 0.3048, from which the area conversion is derived.

citations.label: International Yard and Pound Agreement of 1959
citations.summary: The official 1959 Federal Register notice establishing the exact value for the international yard (0.9144 m), which defines the international foot.

glossary.definition: The SI unit of area, defined as the area of a square with sides that are each one meter long.
A unit of area in the imperial and U.S. customary systems, defined as the area of a square with sides of one international foot.
